docs.snippet: BOKOR--Bruce, died unexpectedly on May 28th in Northampton, MA. A graduate of Dartmouth College, Bruce was a scholar, a gifted athlete and a great humanitarian. Bruce travelled a dark and difficult path for much of his life. After many troubled ye...
docs.lead_paragraph: BOKOR--Bruce, died unexpectedly on May 28th in Northampton, MA. A graduate of Dartmouth College, Bruce was a scholar, a gifted athlete and a great humanitarian. Bruce travelled a dark and difficult path for much of his life. After many troubled years, he became an educator, devoted to the children he taught. Cherished by his parents. Gail and Gene, he is also survived by his sister, Jill and her husband, Sanford Smith, his brother Peter and his wife Jeannie Blaustein, a nephew, Luc Bokor-Smith and two nieces Sophie and Livia Bokor. Interment will be private. Information about tribute gifts to a charity in Bruce's name will be forthcoming. The family would like to thank all the wonderful people who helped and cared for Bruce.

docs.snippet: BUCHMAN--Sylvan. The Board of Governors and members of Fairview Country Club note with profound sorrow the passing of our beloved longtime member Sylvan (Buck) Buchman. On behalf of all our members we express our deepest sympathy to his wife Shirl...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUCHMAN--Sylvan. The Board of Governors and members of Fairview Country Club note with profound sorrow the passing of our beloved longtime member Sylvan (Buck) Buchman. On behalf of all our members we express our deepest sympathy to his wife Shirley of 72 years, sons Peter and John, and the entire family. Fredric C. Apter, President Bryna Sweedler, Secretary
